originalText.text:
I read the reviews upon arrival and was pretty creeped out but still
Showed up
. I was surprised to see that it looked nothing like the review pics showed . The one staff member was professional and the stay was as expected. The tech does just open the door so don‚Äôt expect privacy. Mattress was a little worn out and can be flipped or upgraded but all went well .

originalText.text:
I had an appointment here for a sleep study. Very strange experience.

1) Staff Confusion
I walk in and announce myself to the two staff members. They look at each other confused and ask me ‚Äúwait‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs you?.. then whose that?‚Äù And point to the back where the rooms are. 5-7 minutes later, someone is getting kicked out.

2) Reference Attached Pictures  - Open Room.

I was put in a room and was there until 10:30pm. Unattended. I had no idea what was going on. I was always there for ~2 hrs right after all this confusion. I decided to see what all the doors were about where I was. One of the doors led to access to the rear of the building and outside. I tested the lock but it only twisted the dial, however, there was no resistance, no feeling of anything mechanically happening. I didn‚Äôt like that at all.

3) Using Camera Pre - Test is Weird.

This is an assumption. Once I decided to leave and started to change back into my regular clothes is when one of the staff finally came. Like I said, I‚Äôve been waiting for some time by that time. Coincidence? It leads me to believe that they were watching me the whole time. We‚Äôre they watching me change? Do they do that to the women who go, too?

All in all. Strange experience. I had the creeps. I got up and left. I took my consent forms with me.I

originalText.text:
Me and my son went there on a Saturday night . The greeter brought us to a room quickly, it was very clean (nice smell of bathroom soap as well), crisp smell (no irritating aromas) and comfy. There was a t.v.  that was optional to watch along with some bar snacks. The temperature was a bit warm for my son (I like it like that but he likes it kind of cold) but I was able to change the temperature in the room.

The technician was very patient and gentle and waited for my son to go to sleep to put on those cord and patches on his head (which i appreciated them waiting till he was asleep). The night was very quiet. I was up all night (mommy instincts). The technician came in every 2 hours to adjust some finger device that kept coming off my son.

The only thing I wish was that they had some sort of cord to lightly hold all those cords instead of it twirling every where as he moved through the night. I also wish that they would allow for longer sleep due to them closing at 6am, they wake you up at 5am. My son woke up energized though!

Ooh and one last thing I wish they served light to go breakfast (not bars), which would have been nice!

originalText.text:
I had to pick up my sleeping monitor yesterday and bring it back today. I had to deal with different people on both days. They were helpful and courteous.
I hate any medical related situations, but they had a sense of humor and made an uncomfortable situation just fine.

I don't know what's up with all the hater reviews.

They let me use the restroom, so I got to check out the operation. Their sleeping rooms looked pretty nice. Most rooms were bigger than my bedroom. The bathroom was clean and modern looking.
I hope I don't have to go back, but if I do, I know I will be comfortable.

originalText.text:
I just arrived and this place ok.
They set it up in a hotel setting.
Tv didn't work which is what I fall asleep to.
The last time I went was in a hospital.
I couldn't fall asleep, finally did around 1am , bed was uncomfortable üò£ then this morning they were pretty rude.
Threw me out at 6am but gave me to 6:15 to get up.

For the most part sleep study is a sleep study but next time I will check the reviews first.
